meanings.definition: A pair of punctuation marks (« and ») used in some languages to indicate a quotation.
meanings.sent1: In French, the guillemets are like little arrows pointing to the quoted text.
meanings.sent2: She always uses guillemets when writing in Spanish to show dialogue.
meanings.sent3: The guillemets were feeling shy and kept hiding behind the words they enclosed.
meanings.sent4: His words were embraced by the guillemets, like a warm hug around his thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The guillemets danced on the page, framing the dialogue with elegance.

meanings.definition: A symbol used in typography to indicate a quotation.
meanings.sent1: The guillemet in this font looks like a small, curved arrow.
meanings.sent2: When typing, remember to include a guillemet at the beginning and end of a quote.
meanings.sent3: The guillemet on the screen winked mischievously as it marked the quoted text.
meanings.sent4: Her words were wrapped in the guillemet, like a gift waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The guillemet stood out on the page, emphasizing the importance of the quoted text.
